Source: QuaRTz (Qualitative Relationship Test set) (Dataset - https://allenai.org/data/quartz) (Paper - https://aclanthology.org/D19-1608.pdf)
Definition: There is a question or fill-in-the-blank with the corresponding answer. Provide a clarification statement on the question and answer provided.

Positive Examples.input:
If you use less force when accelerating a car it will go 
 Answer: slower
Positive Examples.output: The harder the batter hits the ball, the greater will be its acceleration.
Positive Examples.explanation: The output statement appropriately creates the explanation.

Positive Examples.input:

 Answer: few nutrients
Positive Examples.output: Most nutrients are washed into ocean water from land. Therefore, water closer to shore tends to have more nutrients.
Positive Examples.explanation: Output gives a fact about ocean shore for the nutrients

Negative Examples.input:

 Answer: expanding
